sect1.title: Availability
sect1.para: This book was written in DocBook/XML, and converted to HTML and XSL:FO with xsltproc. The latest version of the book is always available from: .

sect1.title: Conventions
sect1.para: This section gives a short summary of the conventions in this book.

sect2.title: File names
sect2.para: File or directory names are printed as: /path/to/file. For example: /etc/fstab

sect2.title: Commands
sect2.para: Commands are printed as bold text. For example: ls -l

sect2.title: Screen output
sect2.para: Screen output is printed like this:
If commands are being entered in the screen output the commands will be printed as bold text:
If a command is executed as root, the shell will be displayed as #. If a command is executed as a normal non-privileged user, the shell will be displayed as $.

sect2.title: Notes
sect2.para: Some sections contain extra notes. It is not necessary to know the information in notes, but notes may provide valuable information, or pointers to information. Notes are printed like this:
